item.description:
This exhibit is actually a combination of TWO distinct collections, one photographic and the other painting/woods.metals.  Both show unique view points of Haiti and offer us a chance to reflect, honor, and hope for this country and its people as we acknowlegde the one year anniversary of the earthquake.  Trinity has a lovely campus and options for coffee or a meal following the reception.  We can even stay for a film at their great Cinestudio.

This is the description given on the Trinity/Widener Gallery website:

http://www.trincoll.edu/artsattrinity/events/

Jan 27 - Mar 10

A RESILIENT SPIRIT
Selections from the Edith A. Graham Collection of Haitian Art,
Trinity College

PATRICK RAYCRAFT and LENA STEIN
Photographs from Haiti

Featuring captivating paintings and three-dimensional works in wood and metal, "A Resilient Spirit" is dedicated to the memory of those who perished in the January 2010 earthquake encircling Port-au-Prince and pays homage to the artists who continue the work of their predecessors.

Opening Reception: Wed, Feb 9, 4:30-6:30 p.m., Austin Arts Center

"A Resilient Spirit" is exhibited in the Widener Gallery; Raycraft and Stein's photographs of immediate, post-quake Haiti are hanging in the Austin Arts Center Lobby.

Admission: Free
-----------------

See the website for directions.  The Widener Gallery is within the Austin Arts Center.  There is planty of parking behind The Austin Arts Center
item.name: Two wonderful collections of art celebrating Haiti! Widener Gallery at Trinity
